review_title: Camp Chatterbox: A Summer Camp for Children and Young Adults Using AAC Devices
job_title: Marketing Coordinator in Cranford, NJ
pros: Camp Chatterbox is a speech therapy-intensive overnight summer camp for children and young adults (ages 5-22) who use AAC Devices to communicate.  Campers are grouped with children of similar ages and abilities and are involved in a range of activities to promote use of their communication systems across multiple settings.  During a typical day at Chatterbox, a camper will be involved in a range of activities to promote communication and peer interaction.  At lunchtime, campers have an opportunity to use their devices to make announcements to all campers, parents. and staff.  This provides an excellent opportunity for initiated communication. In addition, recreational activities include swimming, nature, and sports.  Each evening, siblings, parents, and staff join the campers as they participate in typical camp activities such as campfires, dances, and team activities.  Camp typically ends with an “All-Camp Talent Show” that campers, families, and staff have a wonderful time preparing as a final "hurrah" to an awesome week.  Camp Chatterbox is very unique because the campers come with their families, who are also a big part of Camp, and although it is only a week long, it very easily becomes one of the most memorable and wonderful experiences for everyone involved.
cons: Campers, families, and staff get to experience the "traditional camp experience" for the week by staying in cabins with other families, sharing a bathroom, and eating mystery camp food every day, which isn't really a con if you possess a positive attitude and sense of adventure!

job_title: Staff RN in New Brunswick, NJ
pros: Decent benefits. Good hours. Clean.
cons:
Nursing management poor and often unavailable. Nursing management had poor to little grasp of how to orient new staff to the floor. 
The entire time I worked there, I was bullied by my preceptors and the other nurses on the floor.  The current employees complain constantly about the job.  The PCTs work extremely hard and are often treated poorly by the RNs.  Whenever I thanked them, the PCTs were in shock.  
They come off as very nice for the first week of hospital orientation and make it sound like it is an amazing, supportive environment.  Completely the opposite. From my first day on the floor, I was hazed, bullied and abused.  Other newer employees told me that this is the norm.  I was told to do things that contradicted doctor's orders and that are out of the scope of nursing practice, when I said I felt uncomfortable I was told to "get used to it".  Another time, I was literally pushed out of the way because apparently I was changing a diaper "wrong".  I was wrong because I did not change the diaper in the exact same way the preceptor did. 
Completely unacceptable for any company, but disgusting that nurses treat other nurses in this way.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mountainside, NJ
pros: The kids we serve! I previously interned at Children's Specialized Hospital and now I currently work for Children's and I have loved every minute of it. Aside from my daily work routine, I go out of my way to see the patients regularly in order to remind myself why all of us dedicated employees wake up each day to go to work. Children's culture is so unique that once I interviewed for my first internship, I knew there was not another place I wanted to work. Now, being employed for 3 months, I still believe that Children's was and still is the right fit for me.
cons: The distance between some sites are longer than others. Non-clinical staff do not see the kids as much as other departments.

review_title: Children's Specialized has a superficial well respected name.  Working on the inside is a great disappointment.

job_title: Therapist in Clifton, NJ
pros: Sweet and caring families and children
cons:
Overall I would not recommend employment at this company. Here's why...

1.Unattainable productivity goals: You will be penalized if patients do not come to therapy and hounded to come in on your days off (including weekends) to work without compensation. For the purpose of treating and evaluating as many kids as possible,much needed supervision, meeting and paperwork write up times will be taken away from you to fill in more treatment spots. Because of this, you will be treating back to back without any breaks but your 30 minute unpaid lunch (which you will either spend doing paperwork to catch up ). Therapists are stressed and either stay at work late to do paperwork or take tons of work home because same day billing is the expectation. The constant pressure definetly takes a toll and unfortunately negatitivly impacts the quality of care you provide to your patients.  Vast majority of therapists are not meeting their volume expectations however children's is increasing their productivity expectations each year for the next three years.

2. Top heavy management:. Too many cooks in the pot with each person telling you to do something totally different than the next. The left hand most certainly does not know what the right hand is doing. Unprofessional and provide no support.

3. Fast turnaround: Therapists never stay employed here long...1-2 years max. It is like a revolving door of clinicians. People get fed up fairly quickly. 

4. No raises ever

5. Contrdictory company values: children's prides itself on their corporate values. These values include integrity and compassion however the majority of things you are asked to do, totally contradicts these values. Children's is in the business of making money so you will be asked to do things that do not sit right with you morally for the sake of revenue. 


6. Lack of support: you will be asked, constantly, by management,  "what can we do to support you?" and when provided with a laundry list you will be denied and told "it's not in the budget".

7. "Unpaid lunch" , however, management schedules mandatory meetings during this unpaid block of time. 

Overall I would not recommend employment at this company.
